org.placeName: Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF SEVENTY- THREE HINDOO ALIENS : : :
No. 2532 PETITION FOR APPEAL TO THE SUPREME COURT.
TO THE HONORABLE CHIEF JUSTICE AND ASSOCIATE JUSTICES OF THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES:

Your petitioners, the seventy-three Hindoo aliens in the above entitled cause, would respectfully represent and show that in the above entitled cause pending in the United States District Court for the Western District of Wash- ington, Northern Division, there was entered on September 27, 1913, a final decree greatly to the prejudice and injury of your petitioners, which said decree is erroneous and inequitable in many particulars,

WHEREFORE, in order that your petitioners may obtain relief in the premises, and have opportunity to show the errors complained of, your petitioners pray that they may be allowed an appeal in said cause to this Honorable Court and that the proper orders touching the security required of them may be made.
No. 2532 IN THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN TH MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF SEVENTY- THREE ALIENS.
PETITION FOR APPEAL TO THE SUPREME COURT.
Received Copy Sept 30, 1913 EBBrockway Asst US atty
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Oct 4 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By Bow Deputy
HERBERT W. MEYERS ATTORNEY AT LAW 430-431-432-433 PIONEER BUILDING PHONE MAIN 1278 SEATTLE, WASH. MERCHANTS PRINTING., TIMES BLDG., SEATTLE
